game

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Location

  • public class Location
extends java.lang.Object
    The Location class stores the x coordinates and y coordinates (location) of an element.
    Version:
    1.0, May 21 2014., 1.1, June 3 2014. (Added setXCoord and setYCoord methods), 1.2, June 8 2014. (JavaDoc)
    Author:
    Anqi Wu

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private int xCoord
      xCoord - int - Stores the x-coordinate.
      private int yCoord
      yCoord - int - Stores the y-coordinate.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Location(int column, int row, boolean exact)
      Constructs a new location depending on the column, and row specified in the parameters.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getColumn()
      Returns the column (not in pixels).
      int getRow()
      Returns the row (not in pixels).
      int getXCoord()
      Returns the x-coordinate in pixels.
      int getYCoord()
      Returns the y-coordinate in pixels.
      void setColumn(int column)
      Sets the column to the column specified in the parameter(not in pixels).
      void setRow(int row)
      Sets the row to the row specified in the parameter (not in pixels).
      void setXCoord(int coord)
      Sets the x-coordinate to the coordinate specified in the parameter in pixels.
      void setYCoord(int coord)
      Sets the y-coordinate to the coordinate specified in the parameter in pixels.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location(int column,
        int row,
        boolean exact)
        Constructs a new location depending on the column, and row specified in the parameters. If exact is true, the exact column and row should be given in pixels, rather than the grid form.
        Parameters:
        column - - int - The column of the location.
        row - - int - The row of the location.
        exact - - boolean - Whether the column and row are in pixels.

    • Method Detail

        Returns the column (not in pixels).

        Returns the row (not in pixels).

      • setRow

        Sets the row to the row specified in the parameter (not in pixels).

        Returns the x-coordinate in pixels.

        Returns the y-coordinate in pixels.
